raw.title: [ARFC] Add gmBTC on Arbitrum V3
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---
**Title:** [ARFC] Add gmBTC on Arbitrum V3 
**Author:** 0xlide - SaucyBlock
**Date:** 2024-02-05

---
## Summary
This publication presents the community an opportunity to add gmBTC on the Arbitrum Aave v3 Liquidity Pool.

## Motivation
GMX Protocol is the largest DEX offering derivatives and one of the most popular DeFi’s today. The introduction of several new features and integration with Chainlink Data Stream in GMX V2 has significantly reduced the risks of front-running and price manipulation compared to GMX V1. gmBTC is a BTC-USD's Liquidity Token on the GMX V2 and earn fees from leverage trading, borrowing fees and swaps. 

Integrating gmBTC as collateral asset in the Aave V3 Arbitrum Pool has the potential to create new demand for borrowable assets on Aave V3.

## Specification 
Ticker: gmBTC
Contract Adress: [0x47c031236e19d024b42f8AE6780E44A573170703](https://arbiscan.io/token/0x47c031236e19d024b42f8AE6780E44A573170703)
Chainlink Oracle: [0x395D5c5D552Df670dc4B2B1cef0c4EABfFba492f](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x395d5c5d552df670dc4b2b1cef0c4eabffba492f)

The parameters shown below are supported by @Chaos Labs
| Parameter | gmETH | gmBTC |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | No | No |
| Borrowable | No | No |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes | Yes |
| Supply Cap | 3,500,000 gmETH | 4,300,000 gmBTC |
| Borrow Cap | N/A | N/A |
| LTV | 60% | 55% |
| LT | 65% | 60% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 12.00% | 12.00% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% | 10.00% |
| Reserve Factor | N/A | N/A |
| Variable Base | N/A | N/A |
| Variable Slope1 | N/A | N/A |
| Variable Slope2 | N/A | N/A |
| Uoptimal | N/A | N/A |
| Flashloanable | No | No |
| Siloed Borrowing | No | No |
| Borrowed in Isolation | No | No |
| Emode | No | No |

## Reference

[Project](https://gmx.io/#/)
[GitHub](https://github.com/gmx-io)
[Docs](https://docs.gmx.io/docs/intro)
[Audit](https://github.com/gmx-io/gmx-synthetics/tree/main/audits)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/GMX_IO?s=20)
[Discord](https://discord.com/invite/H5PeQru3Aa)

## Next Step
* If consensus on ARFC stage is reached and risk service providers provide feedback on risk parameters, escalate to ARFC snapshot stage.
* If ARFC snapshot stage outcome is YAE, escalate to AIP stage

## Disclaimer
0xlide is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated by any entity for creating this ARFC.

## Copyright
Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

## Summary
This publication presents the community an opportunity to add gmETH on the Arbitrum Aave v3 Liquidity Pool.

## Motivation
GMX Protocol is the largest DEX offering derivatives and one of the most popular DeFi’s today. The introduction of several new features and integration with Chainlink Data Stream in GMX V2 has significantly reduced the risks of front-running and price manipulation compared to GMX V1. gmETH is a ETH-USD's Liquidity Token on the GMX V2 and earn fees from leverage trading, borrowing fees and swaps. 

Integrating gmETH as collateral asset in the Aave V3 Arbitrum Pool has the potential to create new demand for borrowable assets on Aave V3.

raw.title: [ARFC] Add sFRAX on Ethereum V3
raw.author: 0xe2D6AA050C655a3F0f95eFD8F2107778090308aE
raw.body:
Title: [ARFC] Add sFRAX on Ethereum V3

Author: @0xlide, @SaucyBlock and ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

Date: 2024-01-18

# Summary
This publication presents the community an opportunity to add sFRAX to the Ethereum Aave V3 Liquidity Pool.

# Motivation
Staked FRAX (sFRAX) is an ERC-4626 staking vault that distributes a portion of the Frax Protocol yield. sFRAX APY attempts to roughly track the interest on reserve balances (IORB) rate of the United States Federal Reserve.

Integrating sFRAX as collateral asset in the Aave V3 Ethereum Pool has the potential to create new demand for borrowable assets on Aave V3, such as stablecoins and FXS.

# Specification

Ticker: sFRAX
Contract Adress: 0xA663B02CF0a4b149d2aD41910CB81e23e1c41c32
Chainlink Oracle: 0xB9E1E3A9feFf48998E45Fa90847ed4D467E8BcfD


| Parameter               | Recommendation |
|-------------------------|----------------|
| Isolation Mode          | NO             |
| Borrowable in Isolation | NO             |
| Stable Borrow           | NO             |
| Enable Borrow           | NO             |
| Enable Collateral       | YES            |
| Loan To Value           | 70.00%         |
| Liquidation Threshold   | 75.00%         |
| Liquidation Bonus       | 6.00%          |
| Reserve Factor          | 20.00%         |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee| 20.00%         |
| Supply Cap(sFRAX)       | 10.00M         |
| Borrow Cap(sFRAX)       | N/A            |
| Uoptimal                | N/A            |
| Base                    | N/A            |
| Slope1                  | N/A            |
| Slope2                  | N/A            |


# Next Steps
1. If consensus on ARFC stage is reached and risk service providers provide feedback on risk parameters, escalate to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If ARFC snapshot stage outcome is YAE, escalate to AIP stage

# Disclaimer
ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and are not compensated by any entity for creating this ARFC.

# Copyright
Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard BNBx on Aave V3 BNB Chain
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard BNBx on Aave V3 BNB Chain  
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-03-04

---

## **Summary**

This TEMP CHECK proposes the addition of BNBx from Stader to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

BNBx is a liquid staked token of BNB from Stader. Users can freely mint BNBx in exchange for BNB deposits and earn yield from staking.

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract address: [0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275](https://bscscan.com/token/0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275)

Detailed risk parameters will be formulated and shared in the ARFC phase, after positive community feedback from this TEMP CHECK.

**Useful Links**

- Website: https://www.staderlabs.com/
- BNBx docs: https://binance.docs.staderlabs.com/

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this TEMP CHECK on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [TEMP CHECK], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, this proposal will be escalated to ARFC stage
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard wbETH on Aave V3 BNB Chain
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard wbETH on Aave V3 BNB Chain 
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-03-05

---

## **Summary**

This TEMP CHECK proposes the addition of wbETH the Binance Liquid Staked ETH Token to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

Liquid Staked Tokens are one of the premier collateral types on Aave and drive most of the ETH borrow demand. wBETH is one of the largest Liquid Staking Tokens on the market and one of the more productive assets available on BNB Chain.  

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract: [0xa2E3356610840701BDf5611a53974510Ae27E2e1](https://bscscan.com/token/0xa2E3356610840701BDf5611a53974510Ae27E2e1)

Detailed risk parameters will be formulated and shared in the ARFC phase, after positive community feedback from this TEMP CHECK.

**Useful links:** 
- Website: https://www.binance.com/en/ethereum-staking

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this TEMP CHECK on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [TEMP CHECK], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, this proposal will be escalated to ARFC stage
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: The proposal to add AERO to Base V3 received strong early and consistent voting support with stable timeline metrics favoring YAE. The forum discussion reveals mixed sentiment but with constructive points both for and against, reflecting community engagement. Similar past proposals to onboard assets with comparable timeline patterns also passed but resulted in negative post-vote market reactions, serving as a cautionary lesson. Given the high vote support, strong timeline analytics, and the strategic value of AERO on Base V3, the recommendation is to approve this change despite some dissenting voices.
key_arguments_for: AERO is the largest decentralized exchange token on Base with strategic potential to boost GHO and aToken adoption.
High demand for AERO lending and borrowing observed on Moonwell, indicating user interest and market activity.
Timeline voting metrics show early, stable, and consistent support for the YAE option across all quartiles.
Community posts highlight positive data on circulating vs locked AERO supply and lending market activity.
key_arguments_against: Concerns about adding additional risk by onboarding a long-tail asset with long lockup periods reducing borrow-to-lock incentives.
Some delegates changed their vote against the proposal without clear rationale, raising doubts.
Forum sentiment includes several negative posts citing risk and lack of usage incentives.
Low voter turnout relative to quorum raised in post-vote discussion, suggesting less decisive community consensus.

evidence.quote: Forum sentiment includes 2 positive, 4 negative, and 5 neutral posts. Early posts explain strategic rationale, later posts express risk concerns and note delegate vote changes.
Lead ratio by quartile is 1.0 for YAE, indicating strong, stable early and sustained support for the proposal.

evidence.reference: Similar past proposals on Aave Base V3
evidence.quote: Previous asset onboardings with similar voting patterns passed but resulted in post-vote declines in price and TVL, advising caution.

decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline metrics and sentiment analysis rather than ex-post vote tally to maximize long-term benefit.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline analysis shows stable and unanimous early support for YAE.
- Forum sentiment is mixed but overall leans towards support with positive data on AERO's market demand.
- Similar historical proposals passed but led to negative market outcomes, advising cautious optimism.
- Market impacts show positive price and TVL change during event window, supporting proposal benefits.
- Despite some negative sentiment and vote shifts, the recommendation aligns with community engagement and strategic asset onboarding goals.
